:
   Says "the cascading effects" of climate change contributed to the rise of
   ISIS.

(Reuters
   Photo)

   Linda Qiu
   By Linda Qiu September 23, 2015

Fact-checking the link between climate change and ISIS

   "Absurd," "embarrassing," and "brazenly silly" were some of the insults
   hurled at Democratic presidential candidate Martin O’Malley when he
   suggested in July that climate change contributed to the rise of ISIS.

Our ruling

   O’Malley argued that "the cascading effects" of climate change contributed
   to the rise of ISIS

   The O’Malley campaign referred us to a credible March 2015 study that
   supports his point.

   Democracy Now!, "Martin O’Malley: Climate Change Helped Spark
   Destabilization of Syria, Rise of Islamic State," Sept. 10, 2015

   Youtube, Martin O'Malley: Climate Change Created ISIS, July 20, 2015

   O’Malley for President, Sept. 18, 2015

   Crescent and implications of the recent Syrian drought," March 2, 2015
